_header: Listeneth all that been in life
Note: For the version in alliterative lines see 2651.
_description: ‘Titus and Vespasian’ or the ‘Destruction of Jerusalem’ — 5166 lines in couplets

BodLauMis622.First Lines:
LIstneþ alle þat beþ a lyueBoþe cristen Men
                    & wyue…
BodLauMis622.Last Lines:
…To her mede heuene blysGod graunte vs alle þere to
                    be
BodLauMis622.Attributed Title:
þe Bataile of Ierusalem (f. 72v); Here endeþ þe
                    vengeaunce of goddes deth (f. 22va)

BodDig230.First Lines:
Lystneth alle that ben a lyveBothe cristen man and
                    wyve…
BodDig230.Last Lines:
…God graunte vs also ther to beAmen Amen pur
                    charite
BodDig230.Attributed Title: Here endith the Sege of Ierusalem (f. 223vb)

BodDou78.First Lines:
Lysteneth all þat bethe a lyveGoode cristen men chylde and
                    wyve …
BodDou78.Last Lines:
…Till þei cam to vaspacyan[ ] knees þei ham can
                    sette[ ]with honour þei hym grette
BodDou78.Note:
Ends imperfectly because of loss of folios. Last folio is damaged. A
                    leaf is lost after f. 70. On f. 71v the text breaks (half of the
                    folio is left blank) and resumes on f. 72 with ‘And when all þis wes
                    ydoo’.

BodDou126.First Lines:
ȝa sertys quaþ Vaspasyan ful welkes þis þanne I
                    bydde þe…
BodDou126.Last Lines:
…God graunte vs also þerto beAmen Amen pur
                    charyte
BodDou126.Note:
Begins at line 2532; at the end: ‘Here hendyþ þe sege of
                    Ierusalem’.

CamMagPep2014.First Lines:
Goddes men vnderstondeþ noweAnd I schal ȝou telle
                    howe…
CamMagPep2014.Last Lines:
…And þe Styward dude alsoSwiþ fayre semblaunte &
                    speche þerto…
CamMagPep2014.Note:
Missing lines 1-812 and 3114-5184; lines 815-4010 with abridgement, in
                    couplets, ends incomplete at bottom of page; followed immediately by 1193, beginning top
                    next page.
CamMagPep2014.Attributed Title: Nichodemus his Gospell (added by later hand, f. 23)
CamMagPep2014.Editions:
Fischer,  Rudolf Bruno. 
             “Vindicta Salvatoris: Mittelenglisches Gedicht des 13.
                Jahrhunderts.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         111 (1903): 285-98; 112 (1904): 25-45:  111.289-98, 112.25-45.

BLHar4733.First Lines: LEsteneth alle þat ben alyveBoþe cristen men & wyue…
BLHar4733.Last Lines: …All to heore mede heuyne blysseAnd god graunt vs all there to beAmen amen par Charite
BLHar4733.Attributed Title: Explicit hic sedes vel obsidium de Ciuitate Ierusalem (rubric, f. 127)

BLAdd10036.First Lines:
He bad hem go in euereche londeTo preche his name þorw his
                    sonde…
BLAdd10036.Last Lines:
…God grant vs alle so þus to beAmen Amen pur
                    charyite

BLAdd36523.First Lines:
Listeneth alle þat ben in liveBoth crystenman and
                    wive…
BLAdd36523.Last Lines:
…To haue þat blisse & þer inne to beAmen Amen
                    pur charitee
BLAdd36523.Editions:
Herbert,  John Alexander,
                        ed.  
             Titus and Vespasian, or, the Destruction of Jerusalem, in Rhymed
                Couplets.
Roxburghe Club
          146. London, 1905: (with collation of other MSS).

BLAdd36983.First Lines:
Herkneþ all þat beþ alyueBoþ cristen man &
                    wyue…
BLAdd36983.Last Lines:
…God graunt ous all þere to beAmen amen pur
                    charite
BLAdd36983.Attributed Title:
Here endiþ þe Vengaunce of goddys deþe (f.
                    255ra)

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
LIsteneth alle that ben a liveBothe Cristen man and
                    wive…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…And so longe hit forth gloodeThat xl yere he a
                    boode…
CovAcc3251.Note:
Ends imperfectly, with ‘Syn þat he is so meke’ as
                    catchword at bottom of page; blank pages follow,
                    130-136v.
CovAcc3251.Attributed Title:
Here biginnith the Sege of Ierusalem In Vaspasiaun (f.
                    98ra)

PierpontM898.First Lines:
…In to þe londe of chanaanÞat was þe londe
                    þat þo hiȝt…
PierpontM898.Last Lines:
…God graunte vs also þer to beAmen amen pur
                    charite
PierpontM898.Note: Begins incomplete at the equivalent of line 846 of London,  British Library Addit. 36523.
PierpontM898.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “The New Morgan Manuscript of Titus and Vespasian.” 
             PMLA
         76 (1961): 20-4: 20-4.

YaleBeiOsa11.First Lines:
Listeneþ alle þat ben a lyueboþe cristen man &
                    wyfe…
YaleBeiOsa11.Last Lines:
…þey token in to her bandounhe keyet of cites castels
                    & touns…
YaleBeiOsa11.Note:
Listed as ‘Osborn 32’ in Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins,   and  John L. Cutler.  
             Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965.
                    Incomplete; written partly in single columns (I-XXIIII) and partly in double
                    columns (XXV-XXXVIII).
YaleBeiOsa11.Attributed Title:
The vengeance of god taken vpon the Iewys for Chrysties deathe (added by
                    later hand, f. 1)
